author: Devesh K
text:
The Central Bureau of Investigation has filed a charge sheet against a former chief of the National Defence Academy (NDA), two colonels and eight others, accusing them of indulging in cheating and corruption in the process of appointment of Group-C employees.

The CBI has named the then NDA Commandant, Lt. Gen. (retired) Jatinder Singh, his then Staff Officer Colonel Kulbir Singh, Physical Training Officer Colonel A.K. Singh and others in the charge sheet.

Irregularities

The agency has accused them of offences under various provisions of the Indian Penal Code and the Prevention of Corruption Act.

According to the CBI, in 2012, there were alleged irregularities in the process for recruitment for 97 Group-C posts at NDA in Khadakwasla, Maharashtra.

“It was alleged that in pursuance of the said conspiracy, the accused persons obtained huge illegal gratifications from a number of candidates by promising them confirmed appointment to the said posts. The accused had allegedly shown undue favour to the candidates in physical and written examinations,” said a CBI official.

During searches, the agency had allegedly seized huge amounts of cash and documents.

For indulging in corruption in

the process of appointment of Group-C employees
title: CBI files charge sheet against ex-NDA chief
